task.name: hsd_flagdata
task.shortdescription: Do basic flagging of a list of MeasurementSets
task.description:
The hsd_flagdata data performs basic flagging operations on a list of MeasurementSets including:
o applying online flags o applying a flagging template o shadowed antenna data flagging o scan-based flagging by intent or scan number o edge channel flagging
Output:
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: vis
param.shortdescription: List of input MeasurementSets to flag
param.description: The list of input MeasurementSets. Defaults to the list of MeasurementSets defined in the pipeline context.

param.name: autocorr
param.description: Flag autocorrelation data.

param.name: shadow
param.description: Flag shadowed antennas.

param.name: scan
param.description: Flag a list of specified scans.

param.name: scannumber
param.shortdescription: List of scans to be flagged
param.description: A string containing a comma delimited list of scans to be flagged.

param.name: intents
param.shortdescription: List of intents of scans to be flagged
param.description:
A string containing a comma delimited list of intents against which the scans to be flagged are matched.
example: '*BANDPASS*'

param.name: edgespw
param.description: Flag the edge spectral window channels.

param.name: fracspw
param.shortdescription: Fraction of baseline correlator edge channels to be flagged
param.description: Fraction of the baseline correlator TDM edge channels to be flagged.

param.name: fracspwfps
param.shortdescription: Fraction of ACA correlator edge channels to be flagged
param.description: Fraction of the ACS correlator TDM edge channels to be flagged.

param.name: online
param.description: Apply the online flags.

param.name: fileonline
param.shortdescription: File of online flags to be applied
param.description: File containing the online flags. These are computed by the h_init or hif_importdata data tasks. If the online flags files are undefined a name of the form 'msname.flagonline.txt' is assumed.

param.name: template
param.description: Apply a flagging template.

param.name: filetemplate
param.shortdescription: File that contains the flagging template
param.description: The name of a text file that contains the flagging template for RFI, birdies, telluric lines, etc. If the template flags files is undefined a name of the form 'msname.flagtemplate.txt' is assumed.

param.name: hm_tbuff
param.description: The heuristic for computing the default time interval padding parameter. The options are 'halfint' and 'manual'. In 'halfint' mode tbuff is set to half the maximum of the median integration time of the science and calibrator target observations.

param.name: tbuff
param.shortdescription: List of time buffers (sec) to pad timerange in flag commands
param.description: The time in seconds used to pad flagging command time intervals if hm_tbuff='manual'.

param.name: qa0
param.description: QA0 flags

param.name: qa2
param.description: QA2 flags

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In interactive mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: flagbackup
param.description: Back up any pre-existing flags before applying new ones.

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or display the command (True)
param.description: Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False).

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Add the results into the pipeline context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).

task.example:
1. Do basic flagging on a MeasurementSet
hsd_flagdata()
2. Do basic flagging on a MeasurementSet flagging additional scans selected by number as well.
hsd_flagdata(scannumber='13,18')
